Feeling lost in a foreign system doesn’t mean you’re slow. It means you’re navigating rules, language, and culture all at once—something most people never have to do.
Paperwork fatigue is real. Break the system down into one form, one appointment, one week. Progress in foreign systems is rarely fast—but it is cumulative.
When systems feel cold or unfair, remind yourself: confusion is not failure. It’s part of relocation, not a reflection of your intelligence.
You don’t need to understand everything at once. You only need to understand the next step.
